summary: This bill, the Vietnam Veterans Liver Fluke Cancer Study Act, directs the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to conduct an epidemiological study on the prevalence of cholangiocarcinoma (a type of bile duct cancer) in veterans who served in the Vietnam theater of operations during the Vietnam era. The study will analyze data from the Veterans Affairs Central Cancer Registry and the National Program of Cancer Registries, compare incidence rates to the general population, and identify demographic characteristics. The Secretary is required to submit initial and follow-up reports to Congress with findings and recommendations.
